Package com.zanderwohl.chunks.Block

Class Block

java.lang.Object
com.zanderwohl.chunks.Block.Block
public class Block
extends java.lang.Object
An object containing all the information about a block required by the game. A class that contains information about a single type of block, including textures. Blocks are not hard-coded. Rather, they are loaded in from jason files found in that block's domain folder (e.g. "default" or "colors") in the folder "/[domain]/blocks/". A block existing in that folder will not add it into the game. It must also be listed in the domain.json file found at the root of that domain's folder.

  • Constructor Details

    • Block

      public Block​(int id, java.lang.String name, java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentLinkedQueue<com.zanderwohl.console.Message> toConsole, java.awt.Color color)
      Creates a very simplistic block that has a color but no textures.
      Parameters:
      id - The id of this block. Should not be already taken.
      name - The name of this block. A string with no spaces. Ideally all lowercase words separated by underscores.
      toConsole - The queue to send messages to the console.
      color - The color of the block for use in maps.

    • Block

      public Block​(java.lang.String path, java.lang.String domain, java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentLinkedQueue<com.zanderwohl.console.Message> toConsole)
      Creates a block based on a json block description. Information on this is provided in the README.md for this folder. Constructor receives this information from a json file whose name is supplied as the argument.
      Parameters:
      path - The name of the json file as found in the /[domain]/blocks folder. Format like "[blockName].json".
      domain - The name of the domain this block is from.
      toConsole - The queue to send messages to the console.

      Gets an RGB version of the block's color.
      Returns:
      The RGB value.

    • getId

      public int getId()
      Gets this block's id, in this instance of the game.
      Returns:
      The block's id. There is nothing more to say.

      Sets the block's id.

    • getFullName

      public java.lang.String getFullName()
      Gets the name of the block with the domain.
      Returns:
      A String of the format "[domainName]:[blockName]".

    • getTexture

      public java.awt.image.BufferedImage getTexture​(int side)
      Gets the texture from a side. The sides are in this order: 0: Top, 1: Front, 2: Left, 3: Right, 4: Back, 5: Bottom.
      Parameters:
      side - Integer of a side number. Which are which?
      Returns:
      A BufferedImage of that texture.
